• You agree to complete a Minimum Background Investigation (MBI) for a Moderate Public Trust position with the U.
• **Strong background in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, or a related technical/analytical disciplineMust be located in North AmericaFundamental knowledge of Python, Golang, and AWS demonstrated through coursework, personal projects, or previous experience.
• Strong analytical and data visualization skills, with an ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.
• Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills with an ability to articulate thoughts clearly in writing and verbally to technical and non-technical audiences.

• The Sales Development Representative will generate new business pipeline and interest through calling on inbound leadsLeverage the use of Salesforce's AI tools to streamline sales workflows, empower the team with timely insights, and articulate the value proposition of our offerings to drive business growthCreate a great first impression for prospects and customers by providing them with a world-class experienceQualify leads ranging from inbound calls, chats, website downloads, content syndication from third party websites, and webinars across all products in the Salesforce Portfolio (Core Products, Marketing Cloud, Slack, Tableau and Mulesoft)Managing a high volume of inbound leads with a strategy on prioritization of your leadsPartnering closely with Account Executives to help move along qualified pipeline through the sales cycleBuilding a point of view on how to help qualify customers needsSpeaking to value and return on investment vs.

• Org Sustainability Investors Give us your Feedback Sitemap Legal Terms of Service Privacy Information Responsible Disclosure Trust Contact Manage Preferences Strong desire to be in technology salesLong-term interest in a client-facing sales careerSelf-Starter, high energy and positive attitudeCompetitive spirit and the drive for resultsCoachable and Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environmentSuperior organizational skills and attention to detailExcellent written/verbal communication skills Being part of an International TeamBuild a solid foundation on tech sales and NGO IndustryDevelop strategic partnerships with experienced Account Executives across all lines of business to help generate new businessWork hands-on with Salesforce products and expand your technical knowledge Experiences in NGOs (internship, volunteering)Previous internship or full-time corporate sales experienceB2B software sales experience is a plus University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager.

• Technical Leadership: Act as a deep product and industry expert, teaming with Account Executives to develop sales strategies and solutions that address customer needs in new and existing CG and Retail accounts.
• Industry Expertise: Understand customer needs through detailed discovery of their industry processes to identify value and challenges addressable by our platform.
• Feedback Loop: Provide valuable customer feedback to the Product Management and Engineering teams to capture new requirements and enhancements.
• 8-10+ years of software/business application sales consulting experience.
• Established and experienced pre-sales professional, ideally with previous experience as a Sales Engineer/Architect for a CRM/AI company or similar technology.
• Experience in project delivery and working with large groups in pressurized environments to deliver challenging complex proposals, solution designs, and solutions.
• Solid presentation and communication skills, with the capability to translate business requirements into compelling software demonstrations.
• Self-management and organizational skills, able to prioritize work based on an evaluation of different requirements.
